      protected float calcStrength(LASTNode node1, int cpuId)
      Calculates how much node1 is connected to a cpu. strength = sum(communicationTime (node1, lastNodePrevNodes.get(i)) / computiationTime(node1)) + sum(communicationTime (node1, lastNodeNextNodes.get(i)) / computiationTime(node1)) - dif(computiationTime(node1) / communicationTime (node1, lastNodeNextNodes.get(i))

      Checks if a list contains a LASTNode which references given TaskGraphNode.
      protected int findCpuForNode(LASTNode node)
      This method compares the strengths of the delivered node from the frontiers and returns the destination cpu where the strength is greater.

                         SystemMetaInformation systemMetaInformation)
        Description copied from interface: Scheduler
        Schedules a TaskGraph.
        Specified by:
        schedule in interface Scheduler
        Returns:
        List which holds all scheduled tasks ordered by starting time.

      • findEarliestStartTimeCpu

        public int findEarliestStartTimeCpu(LASTNode node)
        Find the cpu which allows the earliest start time for node. Hint: The cpu id as well as the earliest start time are saved in the node. This method iterates over all cpus and searches the cpu which allowes the earliest start time for the node. It also considers all dependencies so the task cannot start until all its dependencies have finished.
        Parameters:
        node - The LASTNode for which the optimal cpu is searched.
        Returns:
        The id of the cpu.

        Parameters:
        graph -
        systemMetaInformation -

      • updateFrontiers

        protected void updateFrontiers()
        Update all frontiers for all cpus. Adds a new LASTNode to a frontier if its task is adjacent to a scheduled task in the related group. If the task is already scheduled (-> in the cpu group) it is not added.

      • alreadyScheduled

        protected boolean alreadyScheduled(TaskGraphNode taskGraphNode)
        Checks if a given TaskGraphNode was already scheduled.
        Returns:

      • hasDepenciesSatisfied

        protected boolean hasDepenciesSatisfied(TaskGraphNode taskGraphNode)
        This method checks if all dependencies of a TaskGraphNode are satisfied (parent tasks have already been scheduled to cpus).
        Parameters:
        taskGraphNode -
        Returns:
        True if dependencies satisfied otherwise false

      • containsTask

        protected boolean containsTask(java.util.List<LASTNode> lastNodeList,
                   TaskGraphNode taskGraphNode)
        Checks if a list contains a LASTNode which references given TaskGraphNode.
        Parameters:

        taskGraphNode - The TaskGraphNode that's searched for.
        Returns:

      • highestLastNodeByDNode

        protected LASTNode highestLastNodeByDNode()
        Find the LASTNode with highest D_NODE value of all frontiers. This method calculates the D_NODE value for every LASTNode in all frontiers and returns the LASTNode with the highest D_NODE value. If all frontiers are empty, it will returns null.
        Returns:
        LASTNode with highest D_NODE value or null if no LASTNode can be found.

      • findCpuForNode

        protected int findCpuForNode(LASTNode node)
        This method compares the strengths of the delivered node from the frontiers and returns the destination cpu where the strength is greater.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:

      • calcDNode

        protected float calcDNode(LASTNode node)
        Calculates the D_NODE value used to select the next task that is scheduled.
        Parameters:
        node - The node for which the D_NODE value is calculated.
        Returns:
        D_NODE value as float.

      • calcDEdge

        protected int calcDEdge(LASTNode node1,
            LASTNode node2)
        Calculates the D_EDGE value which says if the edge between node1 and node2 is defined. An edge is defined if either node1 or node2 is already scheduled on a CPU.
        Parameters:
        node1 -
        node2 -
        Returns:
        1 if the edge is defined or 0 if it's not defined.

      • calcStrength

        protected float calcStrength(LASTNode node1,
                 int cpuId)
        Calculates how much node1 is connected to a cpu. strength = sum(communicationTime (node1, lastNodePrevNodes.get(i)) / computiationTime(node1)) + sum(communicationTime (node1, lastNodeNextNodes.get(i)) / computiationTime(node1)) - dif(computiationTime(node1) / communicationTime (node1, lastNodeNextNodes.get(i))
        Parameters:
        node1 -
        cpuId - The id of the cpu.
        Returns:
        STRENGTH of node1 related to cpu.
